items.title: There’s a Lot to Learn About Crime. Trump’s Orders Are Making It Harder to Get Answers.
items.description: The administration so far has cut funds for tracking bad cops, shootings and violent extremism, cancelled crime prevention grants, and more.

items.title: The Marshall Project Wins National Health Care Journalism Award for Excellence in Audio Reporting
items.description: The reporting exposed the impact of widespread drug testing on pregnant people.

items.title: When Prison Nurses Must Choose Between Loyalty to Abusive Guards and Devotion to Patients
items.description: In dozens of cases, medical personnel in New York prisons were accused of covering up beatings — some under pressure — and rarely faced punishment.

items.title: The Marshall Project Wins Two National Headliner Awards for Excellence in Journalism
items.description: The honor is for outstanding work in investigative and digital journalism.

items.title: In Some New York Prisons, Infirmaries Are Dens of Hidden Violence
items.description: After guards beat Robert Brooks to death in December, The Marshall Project found dozens more allegations of abuse in medical rooms lacking cameras.
